title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Col. 36 (Russia 9)
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 36 (Russia 9):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Arnold - Russian Nationalism and Ethnic Violence; Symbolic Violence, Lynching, Pogrom and Massacre (2016)

-  Baldwin & Heartsong - Ukraine; ZBIG's Grand Chessboard and How the West Was Checkmated (2015)

-  Brudny et al (Eds.) - Restructuring Post-Communist Russia (2004)

-  Bullen - Thief in Law; a Guide to Russian Prison Tattoos and Russian-Speaking Organized Crime Gangs (2016)

-  Clover -Black Wind, White Snow; the Rise of Russia's New Nationalism (2016)

-  Driscoll - Warlords and Coalition Politics in Post-Soviet States (2015)

-  Dugin - Last War of the World-Island; the Geopolitics of Contemporary Russia (2015)

-  Dugin - Putin vs. Putin; Vladimir Putin Viewed from the Right (2014)

-  Galeotti - Putin's Hydra; Inside Russia's Intelligence Services, ECFR Policy Brief (May 2016)

-  Goldman - The Piratization of Russia; Russian Reform Goes Awry (2003)

-  Harding -  A Very Expensive Poison; the Definitive Story of the Murder of Litvinenko and Russia's War with the West (2016)

-  Hui - Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump Are Symptoms of Creeping Caesarism (fpif.org, June 2, 2016)

-  Kolsto & Blakkisrud (Eds.) - The New Russian Nationalism; Imperialism, Ethnicity and Authoritarianism, 2000-15 (2016)

-  Kozhanov - Understanding the Revitalization of Russian-Iranian Relations, Carnegie Moscow Center (May 2015)

-  Laqueur - Putinism; Russia and Its Future in the West (2015)

-  Lo - Vladimir Putin and the Evolution of Russian Foreign Policy (2003)

-  Matlary & Heier (Eds.) - Ukraine and Beyond; Russia's Strategic Security Challenge to Europe (2016)

-  McLaren & Person - WADA Investigation of Sochi Allegations (July 2016)

-  Paul - Crimea One Year after Russian Annexation, EPC Policy Brief (24 March 2015)

-  Pikulicka-Wilczewska & Sakwa - Ukraine and Russia; People, Politics, Propaganda and Perspectives (2015)

-  Pravda (Ed.) - Leading Russia, Putin in Perspective; Essays in Honour of Archie Brown (2005)

-  Putin's Opponents Enemies of the People - The Associated Press (2015)

-  Rosner - Gazprom and the Russian State (2006)

-  Sakwa - Putin and the Oligarch; the Khodorkovsky-Yukos Affair (2014)

-  Sakwa - Putin; Russia's Choice, 2e (2008)

-  Satter - Darkness at Dawn; the Rise of the Russian Criminal State (2003)

-  Satter - The Bloody Czar; Did an Act of Terrorism Carry Putin to Power, National Review, pp. 24-27 (15 Aug. 2016)

-  Stone - A Military History of Russia; From Ivan the Terrible to the War in Chechnya (2006)

-  Stuermer - Putin and the Rise of Russia (2008)

-  Terterov (Ed.) - Russia During President Putin's Second Term; a Business and Investment Review (2006)

-  Tsvetkova - In Russian Ranks, Discontent Over Ukraine, Reuters Special Report (2015)

-  Tsygankov - Vladimir Putin's Last Stand; the Sources of Russia's Ukraine Policy (2015)

-  Volodarsky - The KGB's Poison Factory; From Lenin to Litvinenko (2009)

-  White (Ed.) - Media, Culture and Society in Putin's Russia (2008)

-  Wood et al - Roots of Russia's War in Ukraine (2016)
